entry.title: The Good I’ll Do
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 33,212Chapters: 23/24Kudos: 262

Summary: “I leave in a week,” Eddie said quietly. “Minimum Five-month deployment.”The spoon clattered against the counter, the sharp sound cutting through the air. Buck’s jaw tightened, his eyes narrowing with something too tangled to be just anger. “Five months? You were supposed to be done in three. No more deployments…We were supposed to finally settle down. Put down some roots. Be on the same fucking continent for more than a few months at a time.”Or, They survived deployments and the kind of chaos only Buck could attract. Falling in love should’ve been the easy part. Now married and raising Christopher, they’ve finally built the family they once only dreamed about…except Eddie’s been deployed again, and long-distance is proving tougher than any mission.

entry.title: Sugar On My Pancakes
entry.summary:
Author: penpen_xo

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,903Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 20

Summary: “Eddie,” Buck's voice made his head snap up towards him. Light blue eyes twinkled at him, amusement, mixed with a fond exasperation staring right back at him. “Just try them.”Well world, it’s been real. Tell Chris he was loved and holy shit- Eddie made a sound he isn’t sure he’s ever made before, suddenly very, very awake.Oh my god.“Wha…” Eddie shoved another mouthful in entirely ungracefully, not caring for a second how gross he must look right now. “Whaaaf difd nou doo?”Buck threw a napkin in his direction as he moaned like some love sick cow at the culinary delight he was devouring. “Don’t choke you idiot.”Eddie swallowed the large mouthful finally, wiping his mouth on the back of his hand. “Holy shit Buck, this is quite possibly the best thing I've ever had. This is so so good I could marry you.” or On his last morning living in the Diaz household, Buck makes Eddie a new pancake dish and Eddie proceeds to lose his mind.

entry.summary:
Author: NickyJunkie (Yellowxred)

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,117Chapters: 3/6Kudos: 35

Summary: Buck only feels like himself when he’s in Eddie’s arms—the one place he’s safe enough to let go. His love shows in the ways he clings and leans, through touch and quiet acts of service. And when the weight gets too heavy, Eddie is always there to hold him together.OrFive times Buck couldn’t stop clinging to Eddie, and the one time Eddie finally held on just as tight.

A twist pairs them on a date, where long-hidden feelings finally surface.

entry.title: What Came Spilling Out That Day (Was The Truth)
entry.summary:
Author: madame_bingo

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,360Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 50

Summary: God, Eddie was glad he wasn't here. He was glad that if anyone had to be on this plane that it was him and not Buck, or Bobby, or Chim, or Hen. But especially not Buck. Buck, who in less than 24 hours was going to have to explain to Christopher what had happened. Who in less than an hour was going to be his son’s legal guardian and he wouldn't even know it. Buck, who was expecting a call soon. or When Eddie's plane goes down, he leaves Buck a voicemail telling him how he feels, after all, he was about to die. Only he didn't die. And when he returns, Buck doesn't say anything about the voicemail and Eddie assumes that mean Buck just isn't interested.

entry.title: 911 Season 9
entry.summary:
Author: Oaks118

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 108,656Chapters: 12/18Kudos: 106

Summary: Full episode screenplays for Season 9 of 911. Written to feel exactly like the show with all the hallmarks of typical network tv, but including the added *flavour* of things fans want to see. (The goal is to fill the void that has consumed me since the Season 8 finale and make these plot lines/characters actually live up to their potential, but in a way that feels like the show would actually do it) Midseason finale and premiere now posted!Updates every Thursday. Will update tags as episodes are released.

entry.title: If He Wanted To He Would
entry.summary:
Author: dangerouscoffeetheorist

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,472Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 115

Summary: “The sidewalk rule. It’s a thing.” Chris sighs, like his dad is the most clueless person to walk the earth. And at this moment, he feels like it. “At least it’s sort of a thing. I’ve seen it on TikTok.”Eddie hates Tiktok with every fiber of his being and only half of it is because he’s an old man who doesn’t understand trendy new social media and he’s bitter about it. Still, he bites. “What?” He repeats.Chris looks at him, part annoyed and part are you serious, now. “You know. The sidewalk rule. Where you walk on the side of the pavement near the road, instead of your partner. And if they are, you move so you’re exposed instead. To, like, protect them.” Chris is explaining it like you would to a toddler, and Eddie both appreciates and hates it. But he’s smirking. He knows exactly what’s going on.-/-/-/-Or Eddie and Buck are dating and its really bloody cute.

entry.title: The Accident Leftover
entry.summary:
Author: carrienotcurry

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,080Chapters: 2/6Kudos: 23

Summary: “Saws and jaws,” Captain Bobby Nash barks, looking back towards Buck.Buck’s muscles knot. His breath catches, a sob burning up his throat. He presses the palm of his hand to his mouth, rubbing his palms deep into his rough skin. He felt his pulse hammer in his skull, in his slick palms, deep in his chest. Long before LA. Long before any of this.“You okay Buckaroo?” Hen emerges, voice soft and concerned. Her hand finds its way onto Buck’s shoulder, resting carefully as not to scare him. She looks down into the busted-up car.His world blurred, eyes foggy.No no no, this isn’t how it ends. They were supposed to be here for Jee-Yun, for Maddie. They were supposed to be here to see all Jee go to college, or Maddie get promoted like she deserved. They were supposed to be here to see Buck succeed in life. Buck never imagined this day would come so quickly, at such a harsh moment, in such a horrible place, at his work in the middle of an accident.No matter how shitty they were to him, he loves them more than life itself.Shaky, he turns to face Hen. Her concerned look only grew as he looked back. The words come out raw and reluctant, like they didn’t belong.“My parents are dead.”
